TopicTitle: N1 Rocket Mod, where did it go?

Articles.Content: A little while ago (0.11.1 I think) there was an N1 Rocket mod, but since then it has all but disappeared , I have been recreating the Russian rocket like the Soyuz using the Nova-punch pack but the N1 rocket just doesn't work with this pack, is there still a download link for this mod or are there any plans to resurrect this mod?

The parts were originally from SIDR (Nova's first part pack that's now part of NovaPunch) but when NP grew in size, I had to move the parts out of the pack.

Nova was considering remastering them a while back, but he didn't have time then and obviously doesn't now with his new duties. There was another user working on the rocket using new models I think, but I haven't seen an update on that in a while.

I had kind of hoped to get around to fixing them up a little and releasing them, but I have barely had time to keep my current releases up to date.

I am not sure if the old SIDR thread still has a working download link. I couldn't repost SIDR without adding a license and all that jazz, so right now, I'm not sure where you can find the old parts.
are there pictures of the old N-1 rocket parts?
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/575558/SIDR/SIDR_Parts_1.3.zip

Aha, there you go.

Here's a screenshot. I just scaled them up to take one of the 3man pods, which is what I would assume wouldbe closest to "correct"

I actually don't recall which SIDR engines were being used for the 2nd and 3rd stages in this setup.
ER MAH GERD! Tiberion You Have To Add Them To NP!
YESS!!! thanks Nova!
is there any way you can post the upscaled version? (if its not too much trouble)

I am also interested in the upscaled version if Nova, the original author, complies with it's release. Would be so awesome. A user here named Mivanit is making some soviet inspired things and i'm very excited about that project. I'ts almost as i'm starting to faint when i see before me a massive N1 carrying a Soyuz with Gagarinski Kerman on board for the stars! POYEKHALI!

Edited September 27, 2012 by Raticon
Do what you wish with the N1. Although, I think a new model ought to be made for it. I'm not fond of the one in SIDR, really...

is there any way you can post the upscaled version? (if its not too much trouble)

It's pretty easy to do yourself. Just go into your parts folder, and go into each part of the N-1 pack, and find the "part.cfg" file. Open this with a basic word editor, and look for:

scale = (some number, probably 0.1)

and replace it with:

scale = 1

rescaleFactor = 1

and start fiddling with the rescaleFactor value (try 2 or 3).

hmmm...

if anyone is still working n this would you care to help me with my in-dev soviet pack?

dev page as of now:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/21615-thinking-about-making-a-soviet-type-pack-feedback-please

I tested the original one and i liked it for what it was, but i quickly found out that it needed a few struts to avoid it breaking apart a few hundred meters up from the launchpad. Given a bit of upscaling and a slight redesign of the model as you implied it would be a great rocket for us who are inspired by historical models.

In it's current, basic state it's decent for lifting moderate loads into low-kerbin orbit or very light loads around the Mun and back, but i haven't managed to fit anything that resembles a manned lander with return-to-home capability to it with any success...

It's pretty easy to do yourself. Just go into your parts folder, and go into each part of the N-1 pack, and find the "part.cfg" file. Open this with a basic word editor, and look for:

scale = (some number, probably 0.1)

and replace it with:

scale = 1

rescaleFactor = 1

and start fiddling with the rescaleFactor value (try 2 or 3).

Pretty much. You don't want to change "scale = whatever" as that will mess up the attach/stack nodes, and its not really related to scaling the meshes. rescaleFactor is what you're looking for.

My quick rescale used

rescaleFactor = 2.5

which doubled the original size. I don't know that it would be the best scale in the end, though.

mivanit: Sending you a PM.

I tested the original one and i liked it for what it was, but i quickly found out that it needed a few struts to avoid it breaking apart a few hundred meters up from the launchpad. Given a bit of upscaling and a slight redesign of the model as you implied it would be a great rocket for us who are inspired by historical models.

In it's current, basic state it's decent for lifting moderate loads into low-kerbin orbit or very light loads around the Mun and back, but i haven't managed to fit anything that resembles a manned lander with return-to-home capability to it with any success...

Well, the real N1 was notorious for breaking up about 60 seconds into the flight.

Hello all! I don't know if anyone checks this post anymore, but I am, on and off, as time allows, working on making a historically accurate N1 mod. I have completed about 75% of the 3d modelling...I still need to work on the LK and LOK capsules, IVA's included...
Any progress pics game91?
Bobcat has an LK capsule, and a Block D engine.
I am still working on retexturing the capsules and working on IVAs. The LK is almost complete, however.
I plan to do a couple of renders tomorrow.
